website_summaries.verdict: An exceedingly rated model at an affordable price for buyers seeking a cheaper option.
pros: Smaller design works well in home-gyms and compact rooms
Steel frame makes for sturdy and durable design
Offers foam cushion for comfortable poses
cons: Some users complained that the bench arrived with missing parts necessary for assembly

customer_reviews.title: Do you want to exercise on "Formaldehyde"?
customer_reviews.text: ...I didn't think so. Me neither! I wonder why they don't make it clear that you will be exercising on "FORMALDEHYDE" ...oh that's right... MONEY! I hate companies that try and deceive the public for the almighty dollar, I really do!
customer_reviews.author: IfSheepHadBrains..

customer_reviews.title: Came with missing piece
customer_reviews.text: I had the same issue as another customer. The bench was missing a piece necessary to assemble it. I contacted both the manufacturer and the seller. The manufacturer never responded to my inquiry. The seller was able to get the piece shipped to me, but (as in the experience of a previous reviewer), the new piece did not fit. I am still unable to assemble the bench several weeks after receiving it and it is too large to reasonably return.
customer_reviews.author: m l

customer_reviews.title: Worth it's weight
customer_reviews.text: One of the easiest assembly processes when it comes to benches. Tip- use a rachet like one in photo w/ #16 socket along with the Allen wrench provided. It is all you need and should take you no more than 15 minutes once all the pieces are out of the packaging. Only 8 bolts needed to complete this sturdy bench. Will update after 3-6-9 months...
customer_reviews.author: junior

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dumbell routines
customer_reviews.text: Don't understand the poor reviews as for the money this bench does all it's supposed to. I only use dumbells, and so far using a 55lb pair along with my 190lb body is no issue at all. Looks great, easy to assemble, handles what I need it for. My guess is if used with barbell and heavy weight(there are no brackets so don't get how you can) this is not the bench for you. Perfect for dumbell routines.
customer_reviews.author: WalterB

customer_reviews.title: Screws don’t tighten all the way on bottom.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to be good. The screws in the bottom won’t tighten past a certain point making it really wobbly. I’m going to try it out but pretty disappointed. Will probably have to return it. Not sure why it’s made this way, but definitely not stable.
customer_reviews.author: Liz A Nissley

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Great size, sturdy and easy to put together even though the instructions look like a hot mess. (lol) I am happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Abby Kruse

customer_reviews.title: CHEMICAL CRAP!
customer_reviews.text: Smelled the whole apt building with a chemical smell, had to throw it away immediately. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Blumenthal

customer_reviews.title: Wobbling because of wrong screws.
customer_reviews.text: Shipped with longer sized screws for the bottom piece not allowing the bottom to be fully tightened. Wobbles like crazy. Another reviewer mentioned this as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: needle nose plyers in my cushion!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just received my bench. I built it. Flipped it over and realized there was a needle nose plyers left inside the cushion. It’s trapped in there. I’ll be getting in touch with the company for a new bench. I’ll try to update this review to let others know how the company handles this. Some serious quality control issues wherever this is made...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Bent legs, avoid this one.
customer_reviews.text: The legs connecting to the feet have bent making it lean and unusable. I only weigh 165 and have never abused it, it actually still looks like new minus the bent bars. I also purchased their larger adjustable bench and that one so far is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in HORRIBLE & used and condition - tear, spots, wrinkles
customer_reviews.text: This bench arrived in horrible condition. It had sticky spots all over it, wrinkled leather, and a big tear in the seam
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: The bolts on the bottom are too long for the capped nuts which causes it to not be sturdy and wobble all over the place
customer_reviews.text: The product design is flawed and I'm stunned that there are 73% 5-star reviews. The bolts on the bottom are too long for the capped nuts which causes it to not be sturdy and wobble all over the place. If you want to be able to use this product safely then you'll have to go out of your way to purchase a handful of extra washers.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy bench at low price, use with care.
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the image there is only a lightweight frame running down the middle of a plywood bench. You done want to jump on this bench or put your weight anywhere but over the central frame. Its a cheap bench for a low price. Be patient when you assemble, some bolts and nuts are roughly machined and need patience to properly thread. I bought it in COVID times as a temporary measure until I can find something sturdier. Fortunately I’m a puny guy, so with care I think I can use it. Cost about $70, a good bench if I could find one would be $150 or more.
customer_reviews.author: John Faughnan

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a reasonable cost...totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My Marcy flat bench was easy to assemble as all parts were there and clearly labled on the shrink-wrapped parts card. The assembly information in the owner's manual was clear and concise. I might suggest using a 5/8" crescent wrench instead of an adjustable wrench to tighten the bolts as it would be easier to use and more maneuverable in tight spaces. It took no time at all for me, a 69 yr old woman, to assemble the bench. It feels comfortable, solid, sturdy, and fits me well for my weight training work, though I doubt I will fully test its 600 lb load capacity. Reasonably priced. I consider it an overall good value & quality for my money.
customer_reviews.author: Pattep

customer_reviews.title: Good, basic bench with a few issues
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a great basic bench to get for your home gym or to bump up your home exercises. My issue with this is the nuts to fit onto the bolts all the way leaving the bench loose - we fixed this by purchasing some additional washers, but that shouldn't be the solve. If this came with the additional washers or the nuts screwed on all the way it would be perfect - just be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: The perfect weight bench
customer_reviews.text: This bench is amazing! Just to be clear, I am 6’5 and weigh about 240 pounds. I am also an athlete and lift relatively heavy weight. This bench fits me perfectly and feels sturdy and stout. Not to mention it is extremely comfortable! It only took me about 15 minutes to put together and nothing was missing in the package. The best part about this bench, in my opinion, is that it is extremely light yet very well balanced! It does not wobble at all and is easy to move around the house. All in all, it is a great bench that I cannot recommend more, even at the current price. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: R_Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Tough Workout Bench
customer_reviews.text: This weight bench is dependable. I'm heavy and sometimes afraid to get this kind of product without seeing it or testing it to make sure it can handle the weight and use. It is absolutely perfect. It is durable and clean. The bench is tough and if you assemble it correctly and tightly, I don't think you would have an issue. I've skimmed through the reviews of this item and found some disappointed consumers. Sometimes you do get a manufacturer defect and sometimes you get a consumer err. I'm not judging, I'm just giving an opinion to be fair for the manufacturer that there are some of us who do love this bench. Good work Marcy Flat.
customer_reviews.author: Prissy

customer_reviews.title: It’s a bit too short for tall people.
customer_reviews.text: The only bad thing I can think of it’s the length of the bench. I’m 6.2 and when I’m getting ready to bench, unless I sit in the very border of the bench my head will hang without support at the moment I laid back. I got the hang of it but it’s still uncomfortable having to slide my body down so my head can laid on a flat surface. Very sturdy and light weight. I didn’t have any problems with missing pieces like some people mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Nice all purpose bench at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I feel like the instructions made assembly sound more complicated than it actually was. This is a great general purpose bench at a great price. It’s very lightweight and easy to move around. It is a little bit short if you are a taller person. You also have to be careful that it doesn’t tip because it’s so light weight but that doesn’t happen very often. The price point is a huge bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Vance

customer_reviews.title: SOLID FLAT BENCH
customer_reviews.text: This is great quality product. Super easy to assemble as well. Nice material and is also sturdy. I was skeptical because of others reviews but honestly don’t know what they were talking about this is a very solid flat bench super recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Home Gym Quality
customer_reviews.text: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic restrictions I couldn't go to my usual gym so I set up a home gym. Assembly was easy with straightforward instructions. It doesn't have the usual professional gym quality, durability, or sturdiness but it's probably good enough for most people's needs. The cover material feels a little thin. Price seems appropriate for the quality. If you're a big guy lifting big weights then this bench wouldn't be appropriate for you.
customer_reviews.author: JVH

customer_reviews.title: Simple Flat Bench
customer_reviews.text: Currently building our pandemic home gym, and this bench has been wonderful. Relatively inexpensive, and works great for all your standard bench exercises (we use it for bulgarian split-squats and occasionally dips too). Simple and straight forward. Took about 10 minutes to put together. Instructions could be better, but there's a total of 8 screws to deal with, so I figured it out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: RyanD3191

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: I just received my order and I tried to assemble it but the bottom piece is so dang loose its wobbly. I called customer service waited online for 30 to 45mins then it said I was 1st in line then someone picked up the call then they hung up on me!! How do you hangup on your customers 🤔. I've had my brother and dad try to put together but the pieces are not fitting but its still wobbly!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Moni

customer_reviews.title: Could be a little longer. Otherwise it's great.
customer_reviews.text: I know that many people have complained about missing parts, so I thought I would chime in to let you know that my order came with all of the parts needed and the bench went together very easily (TIP: use a socket set to speed things up). The bench seems very stable, is comfortable when reclining, is the right height from the floor for me (I'm 5'10"), and it light enough to move around easily. My only "complaint" is that if the bench was just a few inches longer I would be able to recline easier. Taller people may find the bench too short.
customer_reviews.author: STX24

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid Bench
customer_reviews.text: A bench's job is simple: to hold you while you exercise. However, not all benches do a good job at that. This bench has a solid feel to it and does not wobble while in use. The padding is very comfortable as well. It is fairly light without feeling too light, and is well designed. I am glad I purchased it, and would recommend it to anybody in the market for a new exercise bench.
customer_reviews.author: Super ManTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: excellent bench for its purposes
customer_reviews.text: Easy to construct. Comfortable. Stable. It is not a terribly large bench but it is more than adequate. It moves around fine. The feet keep it in place. If you are a giant guy w Olympic visions, get something more dramatic. But for mere mortals who like working out and want a good and good looking non-adjustable/non-pivoting flat bench, you will be more than satisfied. It's a perfect sit-at-the-edge-and-do-curls kind of bench. And I use if for moderate barbell lifting, w the bar and weights on separate side support units.
customer_reviews.author: Wigglesworth

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective and Solid
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'1'' 240 and this works great for me, takes a sec to position my back just right due to my height. Shorter than 6'1'' you should have no problem fitting on this for presses. Easy to put together as it really is the 2 legs and the bench. Simple instructions. Good price for a simple dumbbell bench. Solid pieces doesn't feel flimsy or wobbly at all. ****Update August 2017 - This bench is still going strong and I dropped a bunch of weight as a bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Latimers

customer_reviews.title: Great for home workouts at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift from my husband for my birthday since I started doing BBG workouts. This bench is perfect for my exercise routines. Very stable, good quality for the price and was easy to put together once it arrived. Never owned anything from this brand before, but it seems to make good quality benches at an affordable price. Most other benches we looked at were $120+ which seemed excessive for just a flat bench. This one was much cheaper and had free shipping too.
customer_reviews.author: ReeAnne Juntilla

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Sturdy bench
customer_reviews.text: I needed a bench for working out at home since I do not have much time to go to the gym, and decided to buy this bench. So far, I have no regrets. It was very easy to set up, with clear instructions and necessary tools. It feels solid when lying down, and the length is perfect for me. Overall, I would recommend this to anyone looking for an affordable bench to work out with
customer_reviews.author: MVP

customer_reviews.title: Not durable...buy a bench of higher quality.
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly durable... I have owned this for 1.5 years, and typically put a total ~250-280lbs on the bench. It is rated for 300lbs, but that is not the case with mine. After about 6 months, I noticed one of the legs warped a bit diagonally, and yesterday while lifting I noticed for the first time that the entire surface of the bench is very uneven--leaning towards the left side. Time to replace it before I injure a shoulder or worse, have the leg snap in half. Do yourself a favor and get a more expensive bench. Your future gains will appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: This bench looks great, but I wouldn't trust putting 600 lbs on it. It's very wobbly even just sitting on it. I'm around 215 lbs and 50lb dumbell presses make the sides of the pad bow and creak. It's not stable enough to do bench dips without wobbling. I haven't put this in the rack with a barbell and don't intend to because I don't want to die :-) It's probably too late to return at this point.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Gardineer

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, NOT
customer_reviews.text: The description says "easy assembly", but the first thing you read upon opening the manual is: "Please make sure to have 2 or more people assembling this product to avoid injury." The box contains greasy parts, dozens of nuts and bolts, and the instructions call for more tools that you supposedly should have at home. How is that "easy assembly"? I will not buy anything else from this company since they are dishonest about such an important detail as assembling the product.
customer_reviews.author: B.V.

customer_reviews.title: Good bench for a beginner or home gym
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my basement for doing weights and sit ups. It is good quality, but not what you would find in a professional gym. I would recommend this for a beginner or home gym. it is a easy to build, and the fabric is actually very nice material and design. I would be very weary of the 600 LBS rating, I weigh 190 and it feels very stable under me, but just by judging on the feel of the metal and the top bench piece, I can not imagine it holding a lot of weight. Good overall bench that will serve me and my family for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Product is comfortable, sturdy, easy to buiild
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with my bench. Although there is no incline it is economical, easy to store, easy to build, comfortable and durable. For 40 dollars it is can cheaply be the centerpiece of a home gym that needs to have a hiding spot when you're done. Would definitely recommend and buy again. I was torn between the Marcy and the Amazon Basics version and I'm glad I went with Marcy. There are also nice rubber grips at the bottom to prevent scratching and sliding. You will need a wrench to build it and that does NOT come with the box.
customer_reviews.author: vertigopuppet

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best Amazon purchases I've ever made. You can do so many different exercises on a little bench like this. The red stitching is a really nice touch. I even use it as extra seating when my kids have friends over. Takes up almost no room. Get yourself about 3 sets of dumbells, a medicine ball and you can do enough different exercises to where you don't have to go all the way down to the gym. Extremely solid. I weigh 200 lbs and there are no issues with me jumping on and off of it with my full weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bench
customer_reviews.text: Nice bench that does what it claims to do and probably more. The bench was easy to assemble but I used my own wrench to make it go quicker. The feet didn't line up perfectly straight, but that doesn't seem to have any impact other than aesthetic. The bench feels very stable and can support my weight (175 pounds) plus all the weight I've used so far (an additional 175 pounds). It does feel like a lot of side to side movement might eventually loosen the legs, but so far the bench has proven very effective.
customer_reviews.author: Ian B

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a ratchet!
customer_reviews.text: No words on directions. Just a busy looking diagram that gives you a headache to look at. I got it together and the screws at the bottom require a ratchet to tighten, which I don't have. So its extremely wobbly. I cannot tighten it on my own. Even tried pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Zahn

customer_reviews.title: Great bench even for a guy who’s 6’2”
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned about the size of the bench because I’m 6’2”, but it works perfectly. It was easy to setup, it’s sturdy, and comfortable. I’m gonna be jacked after this quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Bynum

customer_reviews.title: The perfect weight bench
customer_reviews.text: The bench is very sturdy. It is the right length for doing flat bench exercises. It might be a little short if you have an extremely long torso but most people should be fine with it. Its a complete steal at the price they offer it here. Most other benches like this are upwards of $100. I love the leather feel to it, it feels very high quality and is an attractive bench. Putting it together was a breeze. I've had it for almost two years and it has held up great.
customer_reviews.author: KTD

customer_reviews.title: It's Alright
customer_reviews.text: It's a good cheap sturdy bench. It lasted about a year of use 3x a week before one of the sides broke. Due to the design, there's a pretty significant lip at both ends after the point where the frame attaches to the bench itself. All it took was being down a little too low on a bp with a moderate weight for that lip to crack. However, I still feel like its structurally sound, as the crack point is after the frame attach point. It still gets used. I'm just worried about splinters coming through the pleather
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Alternative During The Stay-At-Home Time - Marcy SB-315
customer_reviews.text: Our gym has been closed for several weeks now. Began to seek weight-lifting alternatives to do at home. Found some dumbbells with a neighbor but needed a bench. Little available from most merchants. Found this one @ Amazon. Arrived a week earlier than anticipated. Lots to like: economical, small enough to easily store in condo, light enough that my wife can easily move it, super-sturdy. Literally assembled in 4 minutes with a 5mm allen and a 16mm socket.
customer_reviews.author: Jody L. Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and length, easy to move around
customer_reviews.text: This bench is high quality, very good width - 12" and very light to move around. I saw one review from a man 6'2" tall who liked the quality but warned that the length for 6'2" had no inches to spare for him. People with the same height might need a longer bench because of a different body-to-legs proportions. I was worried about the length but the length turned out to be long enough for 6'2" in my case.
customer_reviews.author: Fitness

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Home Gym Setup!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect size for a home gym. I have combined this bench with free weights, an elliptical, a roller and ab wheel. This is all I need for a fully body workout. The bench is strong enough to use with free weights but light enough to move around the house. I'm petite and it works great in terms of the size and height. Perhaps for a much bigger person, it could be too small? It was very easy to put together and all I might do is tighten the hardware once a year.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonLover

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a very nice bench. Perfect for what I need and sturdy, I guess sturdy with some padding is all I was looking for. Other than that, my 13 year old put it together for me so it must be easy to assemble. I am a big guy so it's sturdy enough for me. It seems to be made of fairly good quality material. It's not too fluffy, maybe some might be a little more padded but it's not rock hard either. Perfect for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: Small but impressive build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely satisfied with the build quality. The covering material looks and feels better than the gym. However, if you are over 6 feet tall you may want to look elsewhere. I'm 6.2, when i lay on my back I barely fit, not a single inch to spare. My head is on the very extreme of one end and my but is on the other, its a close call. I'm going to keep it due to the trouble, if it wasn't for the excellent qulity I would send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dudek

customer_reviews.title: If you see it - buy it
customer_reviews.text: Year 2020, April 23rd, zombies in masks and gloves surrounded the city. I was lucky to find it available on Amazon, the bench was sold out in minutes. For the price I would give it 6 s.t.a.r.s, gym equipment is a gold now days. Some infected individuals are even sell ugly diy wood benches and buckets with pipes for $70-200. Anyways the bench is good quality, comfortable, sturdy, bigger and better than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Really this bench deserves 4.5 stars. It's competitively priced. It's a solid flat bench that's simple and easy to put together. Nuff' said. I marked it down a star for 2 reasons: 1. The foam (which is a great thickness and firmness) shifts a bit, its not something I've felt while lifting yet but if I move the bench the foam shifts too. Slight worry that this will be an issue down the line but judging from other reviews it shouldn't be. 2. The packaging was missing a washer for the screws, call me a stickler but missing is missing. Otherwise I strongly recommend the bench if your looking for something sturdy and of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sura

customer_reviews.title: Good flat bench
customer_reviews.text: I needed a flat bench for my home gym that i’m putting together and got this one on sale. It’s been crazy trying to find equipment for a decent price due to quarantine/covid. My only complaint is that there was a bolt missing when this was delivered, luckily i had one in the garage. Overall this is a good bench if you are looking for a reliable and inexpensive one.
customer_reviews.author: Ronito Rivero

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Man, I love this bench. I had one for maybe 3 years that I finally killed off failing a box squat and dropping 300+ on it. One of the sides bashed in (plywood underneath). Otherwise, the steel components held up. Still box squat with it. Bought another one of the same model to replace it for benching. Still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: For the price point this was a good buy. It's sturdy yet fairly light weight. I can't say much for the weight capacity since I only use it for body weight + no more than 10lb weights. It came with a small tool for assembly but that wasn't strong enough to assemble it well. It was wobbling and unstable after assembly with the provided tools, but is now nice and sturdy after I used a normal wrench to tighten the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Lee

customer_reviews.title: Suits me fine!
customer_reviews.text: After a great deal of searching, an Amazon seller cancelling after ordering, and others charging famine prices, I found this one. It's nicely made with neat welds, solid feet, and good overall construction. Stitched decal and folded seams in the top (rather like auto upholstery) makes for a nice touch. Maybe not for the huge guys who lift tree trunks, but for ruggedly average folks like me it works well. And the price was great!
customer_reviews.author: Ranger Guy

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product...standard workout bench. Once assembled, feels sturdy. Slightly shorter in height and length to the ones found at most gyms...but, that is fine. The included hardware for this bench is your typical soft steel Chinese crap that can be easily stripped or cross-threaded. You will need a Crescent wrench to assemble. There is a steel back that runs the entire length of the bench...for added strength. That is def a plus. I am about 250 lbs and it there is no wobble or feels like it is going to break. Aside from the shiddy hardware...great bench
customer_reviews.author: Chris DIYer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you about this inexpensive, yet amazing product!! I ordered Thai while the gyms were closed and used it everyday! I stood on it, jump over it, sat on it and laid on it. It is amazing! The only thing is, is that you cannot fold it up and move it out of the way. Once assembled, it stays that way until taken apart. Still a great option for those who workout at home.
customer_reviews.author: Ariane

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: Chose this bench because it’s easy to assemble and move around. But the first time using it and it broke. Thank goodness they weren’t hurt. I suppose the lightweight aspect can be a pitfall too.
customer_reviews.author: Yumi L.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product, not much more to it
customer_reviews.text: This was fairly inexpensive, easy to put together, and has helped me turn a space in my home into a (nearly) complete workout space. It doesn't angle which some more expensive and potentially clunkier / less sturdy models do. However for step ups, flat bench work, and (with the help of a step stool or stability ball) incline and decline, this has worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: G Myer

customer_reviews.title: Yes, the size is long enough
customer_reviews.text: I spend way too much time researching and over thinking things. I almost didn't buy this because I was afraid it wouldn't be long enough. I'm just over 6' tall and this fits perfectly. (See photo.) I would say there's a few inches (butt to back of head) to spare. My bench measures as 41.75" in length. So, let's see: The price is awesome. It's on Prime. It's solid. It assembles easily. It's long enough. That's 5 honest stars with no negatives. (Oh, also, I personally find it attractive enough to double as a seating bench when company comes over. That was a minor consideration when purchasing.)
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Wetzel

customer_reviews.title: It Should Cost $10
customer_reviews.text: This was made with glue and wood pulp. I can't believe this will hold 600 lbs. It should cost 1/3 of the price. It can't be adjusted in height. There's hardly anything to this bench so it is super light. Easy to assemble, but that's when you notice how cheaply made this is. If you have scrap wood at home, some nails and a hammer, you can make something way better.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Money
customer_reviews.text: The bench arrived with all of its parts and assembly was a snap. Putting it together will go more quickly if you have a 5/8 inch socket wrench. Also a dab of "goo gone" to get the unsightly consumer warning stickers off the feet. :) It looks sturdy enough for the type of light dumb bell and exercise routine that I do. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: So far I'm glad with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: The package came with all the correct pieces. Didn't have any issues with any of the parts. Extremely easy to build, took me like 10 minutes. I read some reviews complaining about wrong screws; all my screws, nuts, washers, and allen wrench came in a vacuum sealed cardboard, labeled with their dimensions and quantity, no issues here. You will need an adjustable wrench for the nuts. Very sturdy bench, and a lot bigger in person than in the pictures. The cushion is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love this bench. Only been a week that I've had it but can do everything that I would do at my gym with exception to incline benching but easy to put away and put together. I've been benching 335 and No problems
customer_reviews.author: victor garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great for heavier people
customer_reviews.text: The bench is good, so far, but feels slightly wobbly. I'm a big guy (6'4" 230 pounds) and can feel the bench giving under my weight when I sit on the edges. I wouldn't trust it to hold me up if I did bench dips. I can also feel it shifting substantially when I do heavy bench press. I feel like a lot of that could have been mitigated if they threw 3 or 4 steel strips on the underside to distribute the load. So, for now, it works, but I'm not so sure about the long term viability of the bench.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Flo

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to your home gym.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to assemble, makes a good addition to your home gym. Heavy enough to feel secure and light enough to easily move about in your room. Just add a week to the estimate for delivery. Mine was a week late and it seems this item sells out quickly and often. So as long as you can wait for it to arrive, it’s a good buy. Now I have one less excuse to not workout.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Solid workout bench.
customer_reviews.text: So far this bench is living up to my expectations. Easy to put together. The bench pad is solid and hard which has taken some getting used to given my old one had more cushion. However, I think the solidness of has enhanced my free weight work. The height is also a bit higher than my old one which required more focus when doing my step-ups and considering I'm 5'4". Overall, I'm impressed with the quality and price which was less than half in what I could have paid for the exact same bench in a sporting goods store.
customer_reviews.author: Matilda

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my home gym. I am a beginner at home workouts as gym membership was getting too expensive and so being on a budget I wanted a good sturdy bench that wasn't going to break the bank. This was easy to assemble at home on my own and is really study. I use it every day for workouts with weights and for body-weight exercise and it has held up amazingly. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great little Bench!
customer_reviews.text: I see some reviews advising about your height. Yes. If you're over 5' 11" this may be a tight fit. As for assembly, fairly simple, however advise beware as the nuts are easy to strip. May be a good idea to use Loctite, just be careful when first threading the nuts. Lightweight, I like that the legs do not stick out past the width of the bench. My old one had me tripping over it every time I walked past it. Compact and great for tight spaces, especially if you stand it on end when done, hence the Loctite recommendation as standing it up and down may loosen the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Five

customer_reviews.title: It is great for mid-weight training, and bench press
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to assemble. it is light in weight and not bulky like the ones at the gym. Works great for mid-weight bench press, and other workout like dips and crunches/leg raise. However, be careful while doing incline-straight-leg and hip raise, and also leg raise: don't hold on the edge as you might break the plywood and pull the bench off the screws. I almost did that. Again, it is handy for normal mid-weight workouts. Not made for heavy weights.
customer_reviews.author: John Parajuli

customer_reviews.title: Great introductory bench.
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality of this product is great. I had it assembled in less than 10 minutes. Very sturdy. I weigh 310 lbs. (yup- that's why I bought this thing), and it has no problem supporting me, plus over 200 lbs of free weights. My only complaint would be this: while doing leg lifts (where you grip the edges of the bench, and lifting your legs), it's very obvious that the bolts holding the bench to the frame are being pulled out. It's a pretty weak attachment method. Just avoid this specific exercise, and you'll have zero issues. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: tb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for regular home gym exercises
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for it's size and usage. I've used this bench for 4 years doing strength training at home and so far so good. If you have enough space and budget for a flat-incline-decline bench then this might not be for you. For my purposes, and with what was advertised to me before purchase, I give this bench 5 out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: Very simple, well built, perfect for my purpose. Was easy to assemble. My only complaint is that I am working out because I am fat and need to build some strength. I laid down on the bench to do some lifts and basically had to roll off. It is too narrow to push up off of, and nothing to hook my feet in to help me sit up. Maybe when my core gets stronger I won't be like a turtle!
customer_reviews.author: EJR123

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This flat bench is reasonably priced, easy to assembly, light but strong--and perfect for the dumbbell workouts I perform at home when I can't get to the gym. I'm only 5'7", so it's long enough for me to do bench presses. What's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Joe Myerson

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy bench
customer_reviews.text: The bench was super easy to assemble. It seems sturdy enough for normal bench style workouts. For those looking to do jumps or step ups on it though, make sure you are stepping in the center of the bench and not on the sides. The bench only mounts in the very center. If you were to step on the edges you would crack the board.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Decent bench for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bench for three years now. It's sturdy enough to bench and do hip thrusters on, but it's about 5 inches shorter than most benches on the market. I'm 6'4", so whenever I lay down to bench it's a bit awkward. If you're shorter than me, you shouldn't have an issue. But if you're my height or taller, you might want to find a longer one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Value for the money/Ease of assembly
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quite rapidly. Very easy to assemble. Comes with a 5mm Allen but you’ll need a 5/8 socket for ease rather than an adjustable wrench as indicated. I added 3/16” fender washers to grip the bolts properly to frame (see picture). I also use loctite on the frame as the footings comes with nylon locknuts. Overall it’s a great flat bench and for my purpose, will serve well
customer_reviews.author: US Navy Reserve

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bench for me!
customer_reviews.text: Wow this bench is amazing! I got this bench to work out in using my Powerblock set and I have no complaints at all. I am a small person (5'8" and 150 lbs). It is easy to move around, I keep my sets under the chair to save more room space and it fits well. When I am not working out, I use it as a normal bench at my desk and it works out well for me. One thing to note is that the bench may be a little shorter on the width and length side for someone who is over 6ft and bulkier than me.
customer_reviews.author: MattTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: Glad I took a chance
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this bench, based on some crappy reviews, and man am I happy with it! It’s nice and sturdy and can hold 600lbs? I’m a heavy lifter and I don’t need something fancy but I do need something practical that holds a lot of weight and this boy is it!
customer_reviews.author: Karen K.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and storable, who needs more?
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so great! Happy to have a bench I can move and stow so easily. I live in a 400 sq. ft. Studio apartment. (Roughly 37 sq. meters) My living space is precious to me as there is so little. This bench can support me while I bench bumbles or a bar. For reference, I’m 6’2” (188 cm) and this bench supports me from head to tail soundly.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Jijina

customer_reviews.title: Mikey likey
customer_reviews.text: This was ridiculously easy to put together. It took 20 min.(5 on looking for a crescent wrench and rachet) I've seen the reviews people having trouble tightening the nuts; just use a rachet until it's kind of tight and finish tightening with the crescent wrench. Also people having trouble with the bottom bolts not having an allen hole because it's not meant to have one. Keep your finger/thumb firmly while tightening the nuts and the bolts do the work and there...that's not hard now is it. Oh the reason for the four star is because I don't know how long it will last. We shall see...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this bench. I've bought Marcy before and was just as happy
customer_reviews.text: All I needed was a small bench so I could do dumbbell flys and press, and sit on to tie my shoes. I love this bench. It's sturdy, yet light, nice looking and is easy to move around the room. I also use a couple 2x4s to elevate one end when I do press & flies; no problem. Would definitely buy again, and I don't always say that.
customer_reviews.author: Ronando

customer_reviews.title: A True Bargain
customer_reviews.text: What a good purchase. For such an inexpensive bench, it is all quality. It comes well-packaged. Each piece is wrapped in plastic and looks great. Even the hardware is labeled and shipped in shrink wrap on a piece of cardboard. The directions, which really aren't needed call for an adjustable wrench, but a 5/8 ratchet is better. The needed Allen wrench is provided. The bench sets solidly on the ground. The top is attractive and firmly padded. By that, I mean that if you press your thumb or knee into the pad, you can feel its softness, yet is overall correctly firm for your workout. I must say I was delighted by this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nightrunner

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. It’s really not that hard to assemble if ...
customer_reviews.text: Returning. The bolts for the bottom are too long. Can’t tighten them due to the nuts not allowing you to tighten to where you need them to be, hence a very wobbly bench. Very disappointed. It’s really not that hard to assemble if you have the right size components. Not sure why the right components are not included. Am NOT going out to buy bolts that work. Also it’s not evident on how to contact seller within Amazon. Super irritated that now I have to schlep this to return.
customer_reviews.author: lvb710

customer_reviews.title: Quality Good. Assembly Very Easy
customer_reviews.text: This bench has a simple design, but the design and components are robust! It took me less than 20 minutes to assemble it because a back problem slowed me down. All loose components came safely sequestered in s blister pack and were ready as needed. The instructions were a little redundant where redundancy can only help. I provided a 5/8” socket wrench; they provided a 1/8” Allen wrench and we were under weigh within moments of cutting the tape that sealed the box. I look forward to giving my new. Bench it’s maiden voyage tomorrow. From its robust design, I expect it will give long, reliable service!
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: A Good Starter Bench
customer_reviews.text: This is a starter bench. It's rated at 600 lb max (person and weights). It did not arrive in one day as Amazon estimated. Overall a decent bench for a beginner or someone doing simple dumbbell or body weight exercises. I would buy again. See pros and cons below: Pros: Build is consumer grade and suited for working out at home for most. Simple to put together with some basic wrenches Light and easy to move around Small footprint Cons: The padding is not as dense and comfortable as your high quality gym benches
customer_reviews.author: kiloerty

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality/value for the home gym
customer_reviews.text: Where do I start? - owned for a year and a half so far - exercise with it 4-5 days/week - it’s light and incredibly durable at the same time - I’m 6’5” and 225 lbs; I can do step ups on it no problem - I can lay on it and do dumbbell presses no problem In short, if you want a simple bench to use at home for workouts and don’t want to invest a ton of money, this is an excellent choice!
customer_reviews.author: @martymccabe

customer_reviews.title: disappointed :(
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to have a workout bench at home to able to workout when I couldn't get the gym, but the excitment didn't last too long. The bench arrived and when I went to assemble it together the screws for the bottom did not screw tight at all making very unsturdy. Sadly back it goes :(
customer_reviews.author: Emily M.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for several months now and it it strong at every level. We keep this around our living room. It looks good and can survive a very busy 3-year-old boy jumping on and off of it all day, workouts and pets. Absolutely killer deal. And it went together in less than 5 minutes. I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: RSQViper

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted from a flat bench
customer_reviews.text: Building out the home gym in the middle of a pandemic is no easy feet. But wanted to add in a flat bench for some additional exercises with dumbbells, dips, etc. Product was extremely straightforward to put together, you barely need to look at the instructions, and its light and can easily be moved and very sturdy, even when doing tricep dips off of it.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy bench and easy to put together. The price is great, too. My wife put it together on her own with just a crescent wrench to tighten some of the bolts (very stable after the tightening) and the provided allen wrench. No need for a second person to lift or help slide bolt holes into position because the pieces aren’t overly heavy or awkward for one person. Every piece aligned nicely.
customer_reviews.author: SandS

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It was hard for me to find a durable weight bench during these quarantine times, but luckily I was able to snag one of these when they were in stock! It's cheap, but it seems sturdy and the assemble took about 15 minutes. I use this one to get a good workout done when I need it. I wouldn't recommend it for super heavy-lifting because I don't wanna chance it, but moderate should be okay. Don't over-tighten the bolts though, as it will make the bench wobbly! If you're not looking for a super professional bench, are picky about price, and are looking for a sturdy bench, then this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Meh - not great for the price. Will be replacing this.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our new home gym. Pretty cheaply made, and when assembled, does not sit flat in the floor. Had to use a stick on pad on one of the feet to get it to stop wobbling. Would be a pain to take it apart and send back, so we’ll keep it until we find something less crappy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K

customer_reviews.title: Simple Yet Sturdy Exercise Bench
customer_reviews.text: My bench arrived in the mail today. I was able to get it assembled after work so I could test it out. I ordered this primarily for some arm exercises and a few leg exercises. It was easy to put together but it doesn’t come with one tool needed for assembly. I’m looking forward to getting some use out of it with some at home workouts.
customer_reviews.author: LBehr

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for a simple bench
customer_reviews.text: I got this at a normal cost, as opposed to covid inflation. I mainly use it for DB benching and hip thrusts. The feet are kind of small, so it can wobble if you're careless, but given the cost that was expected. I've been using this bench for over a month fairly consistently and its perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.author: James415

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble, sturdy, and easy to maneuver when needed
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble with easy-to-read instructions. Very sturdy and does not move when in-use. Very easy to maneuver, when needed. It pairs very well with my Bowflex SelectTech 552 Adjustable Dumbbells. My husband loves it too! He couldn’t wait to hit the weights and do workouts using the bench.
customer_reviews.author: DenayTheDiva

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price surprisingly good quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price this bench is great. If you want to be able to adjust for incline then this is obviously not a great choice, however I don't care to do incline or decline and find this bench to be much more comfortable to use compared to ones that incline or decline since the bench stays the same width the entire length and there isn't any gaps right on your lower back. I would honestly recommend you buy this just for your level bench workouts and a different one for incline if you use that often.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Once again, Chineses garbage. I should have welded a bench myself. Wobbles badly. Obviously no quality control. Not worth my time returning this crap but getting sick of ordering things with good reviews. Amazon censors reviews so remember before trusting them
customer_reviews.author: kristen k thomason

customer_reviews.title: Great basic bench at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Bench shipped quickly and arrived in good shape. Assembly was easy but note: you will need a socket wrench to completely tighten the bolts!
customer_reviews.author: Briana Hall

customer_reviews.title: Light but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This bench is very light weight. I am petite and use this bench for hip thrusts, step ups, single leg box squats, dumbbell bench press, single arm rows, etc. Overall, I like the bench, especially for the price. I do wish it was heavier in some cases. After a set of hip thrusts, the bench tips back if leaning against it. I have never felt unsteady while actually working out though, so I guess it serves its purpose. It was easy to put together, and the padded part is pretty nice-seems like it will hold up well. I would recommend if you're ok with a light weight bench and don't want to spend a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: This was easy to assemble and only took me 11 minutes because ...
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble and only took me 11 minutes because I had to get a box end wrench to tighten 4 of the bolts. For the price, it is sturdy enough. Also, I shouldn't run into the weight limit unless I make some major gains. My goal is to build out my own "gym" and eventually I'll get a more versatile bench but this will definitely hold me over until I buy a couple of ancillary stretching machines and a cardio machine or two.
customer_reviews.author: Social_CB

customer_reviews.title: 😣😫bittersweet
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I love it so much the only thing that sucks someone wet the bottom of it and it got rusted right away I only had it for about 2 weeks ! 😫😖😖😖😖😖😖😖
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: I like it. A little weak, but good enough.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, cheap, little work out bench. I would never attempt to max out the weight capacity. Not a “heavy duty” bench, but great for light stuff. If your benching over 225 off of a rack and using this.... Maybe find something else. Other than that, it’s great :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight bench
customer_reviews.text: I can understand some displeasure when hardware is damaged or defective. In my case, I had no problems. The bench assembled easily. The bench is stable. Others complain about it being wobbly, keep in mind that floors are not absolutely level. This bench is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

product_meta.title: Marcy Flat Utility 600 lbs Capacity Weight Bench for Weight Training and Ab Exercises SB-315
product_meta.description:
Build a better-looking, muscular body with intense workout sessions to eliminate stubborn fat and develop bulky muscles! Improve your home gym with the Marcy Flat Utility Weight Bench, and get ready for a more efficient bodybuilding routine!

Perfect for amateur trainers and long-time fitness enthusiasts, the Marcy Flat Utility Weight Bench allows you to perform a full-body workout so you can build and tone your physique however you want. This versatile bench lets you perform a range of exercises to target specific muscle groups in a compact space. Engage in fat-burning, muscle-building workouts right in the comfort of your own home with this high-performing utility bench.

This bench has a durable steel construction made of premium materials. Its heavy-duty steel tube frame is furnished with high-density foam and boxed upholstery, ensuring steady support maximizing your comfort while you exercise. Created to suit your active lifestyle, this workout gear is the perfect addition to your home gym. The Marcy Flat Utility Weight Bench has a powder coated finish for resistance of heavy wear and tear and can support a maximum weight of 600 pounds.

The Marcy Flat Utility Weight Bench has a compact structure that allows convenient placement without taking up too much space in your home. Its durable steel frame ensures maximum mobility while you exercise. Make every workout more efficient with this exercise gear that combines design and functionality!

Experience all the benefits of a gym workout without leaving your home, with the Marcy Flat Utility Weight Bench, and achieve a healthier and fitter physique in record time!
feature_bullets: FULL-BODY WORKOUT – This Flat Utility Bench is a high-functioning workout equipment that lets you perform a full-body workout to enhance your body the way you want. Build a better-looking physique by doing different exercises with this versatile bench.

HEAVY-DUTY CONSTRUCTION – This bench has a durable construction providing a max weight capacity of 600 lbs. The heavy-duty steel tube frame ensures steady support for the bench, and the high-density foam and boxed upholstery provides maximum comfort.

SPACE-SAVING DESIGN – This bench is designed for perfect space-saving. Its heavy-duty steel frame is highly durable and is designed to maximize your mobility. Make every workout more efficient that combines practical design and performance!

POWDER-COATED FINISH – Reinforced with powder coating, the Marcy Flat Utility Weight Bench resists wear and tear from heavy use and strenuous workouts, guaranteeing you an excellent, long-lasting investment for your home gym.

PERFECT FOR HOME USE – This versatile gym equipment lets you get all the benefits of an intense gym session at home. Perform as many exercises to target and build specific muscle groups in the comfort of your home. 2-yr manufacture’s warrenty included.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
